name: Sofitel London St James

reviews.text: The Sofitel St James is centrally located for the top London tourist attractions but is slightly on the southerly edge of the main shopping in Regent and Oxford streets being a good 10 minute walk to the start of the main shopping area and 5 minutes to the nearest Underground at Piccadilly Circus. Cabs are, however, readily available.
reviews.title: Excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The outstanding feature of this Sofitel is the universally high level of pleasant but largely unobtrusive service from Doorman through Reception to dining. The rooms are a touch on the small side - we took a Deluxe and found the bathroom definitely smallish. Other than that a good night's sleep can be had in quiet and comfortable surroundings.
reviews.title: Can't say enough good things about it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Sofitel, with its touch of Gallic charm won't disappoint.
reviews.title: Excellent service, comfortable room, fantastic location

reviews.text: Beautiful boutique hotel, great location (2 min walk to St James Park, 5 min walk to the theatre district and Piccadilly Circus; 10 min walk to Buckingham Palace), comfortable quiet rooms, amazing service and lots of great little perks - e.g., they turn down your sheets and leave bottled water each evening while you are out enjoying dinner/show. Real pleasure to come back to after a day of touring/meetings or catching a show. It will be hard to stay anywhere else when we return to London.
reviews.title: Highly recommend

reviews.text: The service we received from the hotel was excellent. The doormen were helpful and welcoming. The reception staff were efficient and eager to please. We had stayed at the hotel before and were disappointed with the room we had received on this occasion(more of that later). The receptionist checked on their system which room we stayed last time and arranged for us to be moved to a similar room. Room service was quick and friendly.
reviews.title: nice location, very clean, awesome!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary. I booked the hotel after looking on Tripadvisor and then going to the hotel website. We got to Trafalgar Sqaure and walked to the hotel. The location of it is excellent - a great base for walking around London. When we arrived at the hotel at around 1145 am we asked if they could look after our bags for us as we were a little early to check in. The girl behind the desk said that she would see if our room was ready and gave us a complimentry coffe while we waited. After a short while we were told our room was ready and that we had got an upgrade to a superior room. We went up to the room and were so pleased with how nice it was. There was everything you would expect - a flat screen tv, tea and coffee making, a minibar (we didnt use it as it was very expensive) bathrobes, slippers and an amazing bathroom with a seperate bath and shower . The bed was huge and very comfortable. We looked out over Pall Mall and the room was really light. We went down to the bar to get a drink and the bar staff were all really polite and friendly. We then went out to enjoy our day. When we got back up to the room there was a note on the desk from the manager welcoming us to the hotel and two peaches and some water - a nice touch. We didnt eat in the hotel other than breakfast which was great. The best eggs benedict I have had in a long while. The breakfast choice was huge - a bread basket brought to the table and then a choice of cooked from the buffet but also a choice of eggs, kippers and vaious other bits from the menu.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.disliked: — Forgot to put it in my review - expensive internet access

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Checkout was hassel free and they looked after our bags for us for the day while we were out.
reviews.title: Oh happy days!

reviews.text: All in all this hotel was fantastic. It wasnt cheap £282 for the night however as it was a special occasion we felt it was worth every penny. I was so impressed I have cancelled my forthcoming stay at the Gatwick Hilton to stay at the Gatwick Sofitel instead. I cant recommend this hotel enough.
reviews.title: Very disappointed

likes.disliked: — Very goomy room with almost no natural light

reviews.title: An excellent choice for afternoon tea.
reviews.text: We stay for a two night break at least 2 or 3 times per year in London and normally around Bond St area. We stayed here as somewhere a little different and we WILL be coming back! We had a Luxury King room and it knocks the socks off many of its contenders. The service was fantastic yet discreet and the room was really spacious and fantsatically quiet. Cleanliness is always a gripe for me in any hotel but this was pretty much faultless. The bed was great and I was so pleased at how comfortable the pillows are - I am the saddo that takes her own when I travel (which is frequent) and I didn't need to this time. The Hermes toiletries were a nice touch and the free standing shower divine. If I were forced to moan I would say that there wouldn't be enough wardrobe storage space for longer than 2 or 3 nights... I still love this hotel though.

reviews.title: Top Class Hotel
reviews.text: As a satisfied user of Sofitel in NYC, Chicago, and Washington, I was quite disappointed in the London branch. The hotel has an excellent location near the royal parks and is convenient to the tube. The staff is quite friendly. However problems: (1) my room was in an airshaft and received almost no sunlight (it was actually quite sunny in London during my stay). The gloom was quite depressing (2) One Aldwych and other hotels in London no longer charge for WiFi. Sofitel's charge of 15 poinds is about the highest you will pay anywhere in the world. (3) the exercise room had only one machine, no free weights, etc. Sofitel improved the exercise room in NYC and should do so here.

Checked in Monday. Departed Wednesday. Have been twice before. Well-trained staff. Quiet, clean room. Bar staff work hard and provide excellent service with a smile. Will return. Not sure when, but will return.
reviews.title: In one word: perfect

reviews.text: After being picked up in a too small taxi for six persons,we feared the worst.But right from the check in,everything was wonderfull.The breakfast with a lot of fresh choices,the recommendations of the concierge,the quiet rooms and very comfortable beds,the cleaning staff,the very great location.
reviews.title: excellent location and great service

reviews.text: My husband always stays here when on business so we had Sofitel vouchers to pay for 2 nights at the hotel. It is expensive, a standard room was £500 for 2 nights, breakfast costs an eye watering £25 each. The rooms are small but beautiful, and the bed is one of the most comfortable we have ever slept in.
reviews.title: The Staff and Location make this a special place

reviews.text: The hotel is perfectly located, Her Majesty's and Haymarket theatre are behind the hotel and Piccadily Circus is a 2 minute walk away.
reviews.title: Great Place!

reviews.text: I stayed in the Sofitel for two nights (Superior room), and I think it is a little bit overrated. (price and reviews on this site)
reviews.title: Overrated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To start with the good things: the location of the hotel is superb, all major tourist attractions are on walking distance. Because the hotel is just two minutes away from the underground, the City is also very close.
reviews.title: Really nice Autumn Break - Good Location & Food

reviews.text: The staff is polite, but they are not really interested in their guests and did not make you feel very welcome.
reviews.title: Absolutely Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room I was put in was a very dark room without almost any daylight (see photos), I had to put my nose against the windows to see what the weather was. That's not what I expect from a Sofitel. Because the room was next to a room where they keep their staff I was waked a few times at night.
reviews.title: A traveler's dream hotel

reviews.text: However, the bathroom was great, a good shower and a separate bath with plenty of hot water, even in the morning when the entire hotel takes a shower a the same time.
reviews.title: lovely
Superb Sofitel
reviews.text: We stayed at the Sofitel St James in London's Theatreland for a long weekend (birthday treat!), and nothing is too much trouble for the excellent staff of this 5* hotel. The room was lovely; bed so comfortable I wanted to take it home with me! We only had the breakfast, but everything anyone could possibly want was provided. Even specialist diets were catered for with Soya milk and health foods available, in addition to everything else for English, American or continental tastes. The breakfast service was fantastic over the weekend, although we noticed a difference on the Monday morning, with less staff, a different 'workaday' atmosphere and no constant refills of coffee or juice offered. Apart from this minor point, loved the hotel! Would definitely go back!! (Tip: We found it a lot cheaper to book through an agent rather than the hotel direct as prices are high)

Loved it. Very comfortable, modern and clean with a friendly service. Room size much better than other rooms I had stayed in before in London. I was a lady travelling alone and I felt like I was being well looked after!
reviews.title: Superb room in central London
Highly recommended
reviews.text: If you are looking for a superb hotel in an amazing location in central London, then book the St James. My wife and I stayed there for one night - it was so good we considered barricading ourselves in the room so they couldn't get us out!
Here's why the St James was great for us (in no particular order):
reviews.title: Small room, many technical problems, very expensive

reviews.text: * The bed. The most comfortable we have slept in anywhere. Not the largest (king size) but definitely the best.
reviews.title: This is how it should be done

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the St James for a romantic night away and had an excellent time. The hotel itself doesn't look particularly special from the outside but is in a lovely location within walking distance of Buckingham Palace and Picadilly Circus.
reviews.title: Excellet hotel and amazing location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The inside of the hotel looks very high quality and has a modern feel to it. I don't know if it has had a refit recently, but it seemed to have been very well done - lots of modern touches but also seemed to retain a fair bit of its history.
reviews.title: Just perfect

reviews.text: Our room was great, a nice size for the centre of London. The bed was massive and very comfy. The bathroom was excellent and the shower amazing. The shower head was about 30cm in diameter and just dumped water on you ... so refreshing. Certainly didn't have the low water pressure and lack of hot water that alot of other London hotels have. The Hermes shower gel and body lotion were also a nice touch.
reviews.title: Beautiful

reviews.text: All the staff at the hotel were very friendly though we didn't eat in the hotel so can't comment on the restaurants. While we were in London, we stopped in at The Dorchester which is a much more expensive hotel. From what we saw, it came nowehere near the St James for the quality or service.
reviews.title: Lovely

reviews.text: The only slight problem I had was that I made the booking at the last minute but not through the hotel's site. Apparently they hadn't received payment for my room even though I had prepaid it. I was asked to pay again when I was checking out but, when I queried this, the junior member of staff called over a manager and he resolved the issue instantly.
reviews.title: Central to everything!

reviews.text: I've been staying at Sofitel London St. James 3 times in past 2 years. It has absolutely everything from extremely quiet rooms with absolutely fine beds. You are waiting for the night to get to these beds. Service is very welcome especially in the restaurant. The breakfast is very nice with great choice of freshly squeezed juices.
reviews.title: Best hotel in London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rose afternoon tea room is a must. Very nice decor.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.text: The location is just near St. James park and all main city center attractions.
reviews.title: My lucky day

reviews.text: Highly recommend.
reviews.title: Starting to slip in quality

reviews.text: Got a great deal on expedia.ca and now will never be able to stay anywhere else! Great service, beautiful hotel. Our shower broke and they had someone in to fix it in a jiffy. Great location and lovely afternoon tea.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay at the Sofitel St. James

reviews.text: Have stayed at the Sofitel St James on more occasions that I can recall. The welcome from the staff has always been first rate, and the service continues to be impeccable.
reviews.title: Rooms getting tired, staff still great

reviews.text: The "free" (for which read, "included in the price, but not itemised") Internet access and mini bar are worthwhile.
reviews.title: The Perfect London Hotel?

likes.disliked: — Internet was too expensive (GBP15 per day!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While the public areas remain in excellent condition, the rooms are starting to look somewhat shabby and worn.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel!

reviews.text: My most recent stay was in a junior suite: while of a good size, the furniture was chipped and marked; the sofa showed considerable wear, with stains on the cushions. It's all looking a bit tired, which at these prices is unacceptable.
reviews.title: Elegant luxury in the center of London

reviews.text: The Sofitel St James used to be *the* place to stay, now its fading. The quality of the rooms needs improving if they want to stay ahead of the pack.
reviews.title: Central Location, Great Service

reviews.text: My wife, daughter and myself have just returned from a 3 day stay in Sofitel St James, and thoroughly enjoyed all aspects of our stay at the hotel. The location, staff and rooms were second to none, with incredible attention to detail. We requested a cot for my 15 month old daughter, and found a baby bathrobe, teddy, baby bath and rubber duck in the room - such a level of service.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really cannot fault the hotel and will definitely be staying here next time I visit london.
reviews.title: Thoroughly enjoyed the Sofitel St James

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Mum and I were given some free train tickets and decided on a shopping weekend in London.
reviews.title: Thumps up! Very nice.

likes.liked: — Beautiful hotel and friendly attentive service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel via LateRooms and got a great deal so was really excited to be going - the hotel didn't disappoint.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, good location!

reviews.text: It is very well located and is in easy walking distance of Piccadilly Circus, Regent Street, the Theatre District, Buckingham Palace, Trafalgar Square - the list goes on.
reviews.title: Simply the best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 2-5 December 2010 in Superior room.
reviews.title: Very nice experience.

reviews.text: A very comfortable contemporary style hotel in a good location. Although, surprised and disappointed there was no bellboy when we arrived in our taxi. However, nice and easy check-in procedure (as well as check-out). Public areas as well as the room were in an excellent condition. Guessing the management must be looking after maintenance carefully. Room pretty small but comfortable. Bathroom large with good amenities (Hermes). Bed very comfortable. Majority of staff seem to be French. Very polite and service minded. The bartenders made a special impression being very helpful and professional. Room service was quick and we had a delicious breakfast in the room.
reviews.title: Excellent service and location.

reviews.text: The hotel has a excellent staff, good rooms, a wonderful bed and employes like Guilherme (front desk) and Fernanda (restaurant) that make a better stay.
reviews.title: it was fabulous

reviews.text: I had a very nice stay at Sofitel St James. The staff was particularly helpfull. The next time I will travel to london for business I will stay there.
reviews.title: Excellent staff

reviews.text: I booked a Sofitel Excellence Package for our 5th wedding anniversary online. This package was supposed to include early check-in at 11am, late check-out at 4pm, champagne in the room and complimentary English breakfast in the room.
reviews.title: Beware Booking Online!
Fantastic!!
reviews.text: We arrived at approximately 1pm and were told that our room wasn't ready. When I pointed out that it should have been ready since 11am the receptionist had to seek help from a colleague. Some twenty minutes later (after I had showed him how to take a swipe of my credit card!) we were given keys to a different room. The room itself was fantastic (deluxe I think), massive bed and luxurious bedding with a lovely bathroom. No champagne but I was told it would be put there in the afternoon

We then hurried down to the Brasserie where I had lunch reservations for 1.30pm (or so I thought). It turns out they had us down for 1pm and had given our table away, now I don't know who's fault this was but had I not taken twenty minutes checking in we may have made it in time. They asked us to wait in the bar (where I received the worst service I have ever come across) but after forty-five minutes we decided to go somewhere else.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel. All facilities, Good price. Great location. Friendly too!

reviews.text: We got back about 5pm and still no champagne so I called reception and it arrived 1 hour later. Went to the Opera and came back to have room service. The food was delicious, some may think it's a bit pricey (£15 for a club sandwich) but it's the best I have had. Breakfast in the room was a lovely treat and the food was pretty good but we didn't appreciate being interrupted by the maid who'd come to service the room - they just seem to let themselves in.
reviews.title: Little Gem but Little minded managers

reviews.text: Went out ice skating at Tower of London and returned about 2pm and we couldn't get into our room. Another trip to reception got us back in. Finally checked out about 3pm and they tried to charge us for breakfast but they took it off. I don't know if it would have been any different booking direct but they managed to foul up every single aspect of the Sofitel Excellence Package which turned what should have been a lovely experience into a bit of a sour one (especially at the price of £250 +VAT).
reviews.title: Great Service, Great Location, Great Hotel

reviews.text: Excellent service, managements very helpful. Great breakfast! Located between sightseeings are of London Picadidilly and Trafalgar Square. Walking distances to The Westend Teathers. Definitely will be back again.
reviews.title: The management and staffs are very helpful, great location and value for money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's hard to get a better location in London. The Sofitel is slap bang close to Trafalgar Square, Piccadilly Circus, Leicester Square, Regent St .... all within walking distance.
reviews.title: Very stylish

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are smallish, but very well appointed. We were firstly given a room with a 'brick wall' view, but managed to get upgraded to a street view. It makes all the difference.
reviews.title: Another wonderful stay at the Sofitel St James

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff are very nice, and extremely helpful.
reviews.title: Great hotel with a fantastic location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In terms of food, we only ate here once for a theatre special. Surprisingly good for the price. The cocktail bar ....not cheap (in fact 100 pounds went very quickly for 4 drinks ... but we did tip) but the staff turn the whole scene into entertainment. It's a seriously good cocktail bar.
reviews.title: Stylish and sophisticated

reviews.text: Chose hotel due to it's central location just south of Piccadilly Circus. Also got a 3-for-2 night deal, though the per night rate was still above $200, though most hotels in the area are even more pricey. Plush rooms with good service that you'd expect in a luxury-branded hotel. Nice 24-access Spa/fitness facility. Nightly live piano from the balcony overlooking the lobby. Only a few blocks to the Piccadilly Circus tube station provided easy access across London and also Heathrow (4.5-Pounds, 1-way, off-peak). Used the tube more than walking as a strong cold snap hit during my stay. Still able to easily walk to Trafalgar Sqr and National Gallery where you can then start a walking tour down Whitehall to the Horse Guards, 10 Downing St, Westminster Abbey, Houses of Parliament/Big Ben, and across St James Park to Buckingham Palace. Nearby theaters and restaurants also in Leicester Sqr. Well-worth splurging a bit in London with the ease of access to all the main touring sites.
reviews.title: Splurge in London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is my "go to" hotel in London. The location is terrific -- central to shopping, key tourist sites, and to the West End theater. It is a large enough hotel to have all of the services that you want, but small enough to be personable and to feel like your home away from home. The staff are very personable, professional, and bilingual English / French. The concierge staff are outstanding -- very knowledgeable and helpful. The Brasserie Roux restaurant is excellent. Overall, after 11 nights of stay, I highly recommend the Sofitel St. James at 6 Waterloo Place.
reviews.title: Sofitel St. James London is GREAT!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were fortunate enough to have stayed at this hotel during the heatwave in London this past summer , and we were glad to have done so . The room was excellent (as a gold Aclub member my partner ) we were upgraded to a better room category . We could not have fauled the place ,as it was clean and spotless , the consierge was very helpful in booking us restaurants , and advising us of places to go , that were of interest to us. We did found the internet charges quite steep , but in our case it was included in the price . Sampled the breakfast and we found it fulfilling . i would not hesitate to stay there again
reviews.title: Sheer elegance ... at a price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Sofitel St. James for 10 days beginning the first of November. The Four Seasons Mayfair was our "regular" hotel previously, but it was undergoing a renovation so we chose the Sofitel. Boy, am I glad we did. We LOVED it. The location is superb, you can walk to everything. We had a Junior Suite, which by American standards is quite small, but by London standards it was very gracious, a separate tub & shower, little seating area and excellent toiletries! The maid service is truly outstanding, the room was always impeccably cleaned, little treats left every other day or so, Evian water on the bedside tables after turn down. We're the kind of travelers that do not set a schedule and sleep in in the morning or take a nap in the afternoon before heading out to the theatre. The room was quiet and we were never disturbed. On the other hand, if we called for extra towels, pillows or toiletries, they were waiting for us when we came home from the theatre. We ate in the Tea Room and Bar a few times and the service was excellent, very friendly and accommodating. On one occasion we were too late for the actual Tea but the waitress went out of her way to get some warm scones & jam for me. Concierge were very friendly, although I must say we did better getting our theatre tickets on our own and ended up with better seats and in one case the Concierge told us there were no tickets available for a particular show and we called and got them ourselves. So, in this day and age, I guess needing a middle man for tickets isn't such a big deal when you can just call the theatre or use your laptop. Oh, and the wireless was free, none of that tacking on another $15 a day for wireless. We were so very comfortable that we felt like our suite was our own little Studio apartment in St. James. It's not inexpensive, but nothing in London is and you get what you pay for. The Sofitel is a class act and a wonderful place to stay if you want to be very comfortable and in close to it all.
reviews.title: Our Studio in London
Great central location with a wonderful room
reviews.text: A London stay on a European business trip - with my wife accompanying me. Immediately upon arriving the front desk staff offered a free upgrade to our room. The room was exceptional - large for European standards; with lots of closet space and an incredible bathroom.
Concierge staff were both friendly and professional, and went beyond expectation in reserving tables at London restaurants.
reviews.title: 5-star hotel in 5-star location

reviews.text: The only negative, and a small one, was the somewhat aloof, or indifferent, service in the lobby lounge.
reviews.title: Exquisite Elegance
Simply fantastic
reviews.text: Excellent hotel and very kind staff. Highly recommended.

reviews.title: Chic style and location location
reviews.text: Modern chic styling and an unbeatable location make this boutique hotel something special. Although we had only booked a Classic (Standard) Room it truly exceeded our expectations. The room (632) was on the top floor and situated in a corner of the building offering a dual aspect, however the view was over the roof tops at the back of the building - very quiet.

First of all, the rooms can be different in terms of layout (two other rooms I've viewed with the rainforest showerhead in addition to the normal showerhead, one another even have a separate shower area) whereas mine doesn't), and I definitely got the short end of the stick compared to other people I know staying there. Very disappointing since I've to stay for two weeks, whereas the rest I was with just have to put up with it for a few days.
reviews.title: Surprisingly poor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Amenities that I would have thought are standard, e.g. toothbrushes, comb, were not provided, despite them trying to wow with hermes shower gel, shampoo and conditioner. Early check-ins, etc, which were supposed to have been arranged for some of my colleagues, seemed to be pachy and missing for some.
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay.

reviews.text: Perhaps this is in keeping with Sofitel London in general, since in the previous stay with Sofitel Heathrow was such that they provided the shampoo, shower gel and lotion, but not the conditioner. And here, it's the shampoo, shower gel, conditioner and no lotion.
reviews.title: Great location, nice rooms and attentive service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The wardrobe was falling apart - you can see where the wood panels are joined coming off, and one of the poles forming the rack for the iron in the wardrode was broken. The pole for hanging the clothes is also too far out (or the hangers too wide), that the sliding door cannot be pulled over without pushing the hangers askew.
reviews.title: A great location!

reviews.text: Would probably not stay here if I've a choice (and most of the people I know extending are moving to other hotels), and was glad previously I chose another hotel for one+ week in Oct - Nov 2011 as the Sofitel Heathrow experience in Sep 2011 was still fresh in mind.
reviews.title: Great location, wonderful atmosphere

reviews.text: This is a truly fantastic hotel with great service and a great location, just minutes from Piccadilly Circus and Trafalgar Square.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay - highly recommended

likes.liked: — excellent service, great decor, central location

reviews.text: The room was large and well furnished. The hallway of our room was larger than some hotel rooms in London! The room itself was spacious with a desk, couch, coffee table and very comfortable king sized bed with plenty of open floor space. The bathroom was also quite spacious, with a large stand up shower, plenty of counter space, numerous plush towels, robes, comfy slippers, a hair dryer and Hermes toiletries.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was enough room for a roll-away twin bed for our daughter, although we had brought our own portable crib for her. Which leads me to another great point about the Sofitel: excellent service. Upon arriving in the room, I asked that the roll-away bed be removed and that the mini-bar be emptied so that we could store food for our daughter there. Two separate people arrived to take care of each issue, each within 5 minutes of our arrival. They were quick and polite in doing their tasks. Additionally, later in our stay the stopper in our sink became stuck and would not drain - again, someone from maintenance was there to fix it within less than 5 minutes with speed and courtesy.
reviews.title: A fantastic hotel well deserving of its 5 stars!

likes.liked: — The bed, the luxury, the staff
likes.disliked: — Lack of parking, no free Wi-Fi

reviews.text: The room was smartly designed with a single switch by the door that turned off all the lights and an electronic version of the "do not disturb" or "service please" sign - quite ingenious. Numerous other nice touches abounded – umbrellas, good storage space, wireless internet, a flat screen TV, etc.
reviews.title: Sofitel St. James - An Oasis

reviews.text: We had dinner from room service one night during our stay and were pleasantly surprised by how good it was.
reviews.title: Good location, nothing to criticize
London long weekend
reviews.text: Hotel located perfectly near St. James Park in the centre of the triangle Trafalgar Square, Picadilly Circus and Buckinham Palace, and many major attractions within walking distance. Superb breakfast, very friendly and professional service, quiet and relaxing rooms. No wishes for improvement left.
it was my second stay in a month
reviews.title: comfortable with good restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the restaurant was very good for breakfast and for dinner
reviews.title: Excellent location, great service and room
Fantastic Hotel
reviews.text: We moved to the Sofitel from the Walforf Hilton where the hotel was dark and dingy...

The Sofitel by contrast was inviting, light, spacious with a courteous and very professional staff. My room was a junior suite and was spacious with a large bathroom, two closets and a window on Wellington Place. The windows are old fashioned sash models that open so I could enjoy the cool London breeze.
reviews.title: Really Liked this upscale Hotel

reviews.text: Everything was first rate and the prices were better than any other four star I saw North of the river.
reviews.title: Fantastic

likes.liked: — The room, the bathroom amenities and the bed.
likes.disliked: — The bar (still it did not stop me from having adrink there with friends and enjoying it!)

reviews.text: This is a lovely Hotel located near Buckingham Palace. It has wonderful amenities like HDTV Flat Panel TV's, Robes, Slippers, Newspaper Daily, Great Bathroom with telephone, excellent wardrobe for your clothes, a secure safe and fast elevators. The only downside is that it is not REAL close to a tube stop. You have to walk a great deal of stairs to take the closest way from the Palace or walk around for a couple of city blocks instead. Overall it was more than worth the money. The Doorman got me cabs quickly and was very friendly. Word of warning: The minibar is pressure sensitve and if you lift a drink to look at it, it is charged to your room. Another problem was that someone charged an expensive meal to my room and we were not even at the hotel. It was taken off my bill after they verified it was not my signature or even my name.
reviews.title: Great experience

likes.disliked: — Tiny room given at the start

reviews.text: Really loved this place and hope to return. I give it an A+
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel, couple of Problems

likes.disliked: — Brick wall view/Shower with a mind of it's own

reviews.text: Great location, nice room with sofest bed I've ever slept on, but not exactly worth the money. If you can get it for a good price, I would recommend it, for list price maybe not.
reviews.title: Lovely location, but v expensive

reviews.text: The harpist is the rose lounge is great whilst having a coffee and danish.
reviews.title: Gorgeous hotel!!!

reviews.text: I have just returned from this hotel. I booked it for me and my mum for mothers day.
reviews.title: Comfiest Bed Ever!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent two nights at this hotel. We upgraded to a Deluxe room on arrival which was good and as other reviewers have said the bed was very comfortable. The reception and breakfast service was particularly good. The maid service and late night bar service seemed overstretched and not up to a 5* standard on this occassion. The gym was small. Overall it was a good stay and we would return to this hotel.
reviews.title: Great location, good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed the night of the 18th May at the hotel in a dbl upgraded room, although as the previous correspondent said ,it didnt have a walk in shower, but the bathroom was lovely nonetheless. A very nice hotel, attentive staff - but expensive drinks. However, when you balance that with a very competitive £20.00 3 course price fixe menu it balances out.
reviews.title: Location Location Location

reviews.text: Breakfasts are also quite expensive, but we chose to eat a 100 meteres up the road at Marios, all inclusive for around a fiver, and very nice - allbeit not as grand as the Sofitel. I would stay at the hotel again, just for the beds !
reviews.title: Wonderful stay

reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights at the Sofitel St James during a business trip in London. We were a party of 3 persons and we booked a suite and 2 sglb. Our experience was great. The rooms, even the sglb were quite comfortable and equipped with all amenities. I have stayed in many London hotels and I have seen sglb to be a kind of cell. The staff were very polite and helpful. The concierge booked us in a very good restaurant in Kensington. Sofitel staff thank you for the wonderful stay. We 'll be back.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: Stayed one night for our wedding anniversary having secured a good deal for a superior room through the hotel's own website. On arrival we were given a complimentary upgrade to a deluxe room, however the room was still on the small side and didn't have a separate shower (as is advertised on the website) so I think we got one of the less deluxe, deluxe rooms!! The greetinbg we had was fantastic though - very friendly.
reviews.title: C'est magnifique!

likes.liked: — The blissful beds and the flower displays in the public areas.
likes.disliked: — The cleaner who wouldn't let us in the room, and having to pay for the WLAN.

reviews.text: My Husband took me here as part of a theatre break as a birthday present in June 2005.
reviews.title: Gorgeous Peaceful Hotel with a Great Restaurant!

reviews.text: Initially it looked like we were on course for disaster as the hotel claimed that they currently had no clean rooms available for the price we had paid and offered an upgrade but on our insistence that they made good our booking a room suddenly became free.
reviews.title: A luxurious quiet oasis in the heart of London
my favourite in london
reviews.text: I was so impressed with the hotel for the price that my husband paid on priceline. The bedrooms were a reasonable size (for London) and the bed was soooooooo comfortable.
We had a pre theatre dinner deal in the restaurant before going to see our show. The food and the price were amasing and i have been ribbing my husband ever since to take me back.
reviews.title: Easily surpassed very high expectations

reviews.text: The only small detractor was the cost of drinks in the hotel bar but as everything else was so perfect we couldn't complain!
reviews.title: The perfect place near Piccadilly Square

description: Sofitel London St James lies discreetly at the very heart of London. Created in a magnificent grade II listed building, the 183-room hotel boasts accommodation to suit every taste. The hotel features "The Balcon" French brasserie, the St James Bar elegant cocktail bar and the sumptuous Rose Lounge. It is also the perfect place to unwind with the gym and relaxation space, So FIT by Sofitel, and So SPA by Sofitel, a new kind of Spa experience.
